did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Dr. David Ashley White is currently the Director of the Moores School of Music at the University of Houston, where he is also professor of composition and theory. This collection consists of published and manuscript scores, programs, correspondence, audio-visual materials, and other items relating to his career as both a composer and music instructor.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Dr. David Ashley White Papers, Courtesy of Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Dr. David Ashley White, 1991-present.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Special Collections owns the physical items in our collections, but copyright normally belongs to the creator of the materials or their heirs. The researcher has full responsibility for determining copyright status, locating copyright holders, and abiding by current copyright laws when publishing or displaying copies of Special Collections material in print or electronic form. For more information, consult the appropriate librarian.

controlaccess.head: Subjects (Organizations)
controlaccess.corpname: University of Houston. Office of the President.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Dr. David Ashley White is currently the Director of the Moores School of Music at the University of Houston, where he is also professor of composition and theory. He was born on December 11, 1944 in San Antonio, Texas. Dr. White began his musical education at Del Mar College in Corpus Christi, Texas earning an Associate of Arts in 1966. He then transferred to the University of Houston in 1966 to pursue an undergraduate degree in oboe performance, which he earned in 1970; he finished a Master's degree in Composition at the University of Houston in 1974. He went on to the University of Texas at Austin and received his Doctor of Musical Arts in Composition in 1978. Dr. White has taught at the University of Houston since 1975, first as lecturer and then as instructor. He became Assistant Professor in 1978 and Associate Professor in 1983; he has been a full Professor since 1990. Dr. White was appointed Director in 1999.

David Ashley White's secular and sacred compositions are widely performed and published. Sources for his frequent commissions include Piccolo Spoleto, the Texas Chamber Orchestra, the Mirecourt Trio, the Green Lake Festival, the Concert Chorale of Houston, Del Mar College, the University of Houston, the Houston Harpsichord Society, Houston Masterworks Chorus, the Houston Chamber Choir, and a number of churches and individuals. Since 1980 he has received the ASCAP Award for music composition.

White is currently resident composer for the Houston Chapter of the American Guild of Organists (AGO). In 1991 and 1995 he was composer-in-residence at the Mississippi conference on Music and Liturgy, as he was in July 1998 at the Evergreen Church Music Conference in Colorado. White was winner of the 1993 composition contest sponsored by St. Paul United Church of Christ, Chicago ( Cantata Domino for mixed voices, brass, and organ, published by Paraclete Press). He has also won first prizes from the Episcopal diocese of Alabama, the Virginia Bandmasters Association, and the Texas Federation of Music Clubs.

David Ashley White is a prolific composer whose secular publishers are E.C. Schirmer, Southern Music Company and Shawnee Press, and his sacred music publishers include Selah, Paraclete, St. James, Abingdon, Trinitas, Hinshaw, and MorningStar. His hymns are found in a number of books, including The Hymnal 1982 (Episcopal), the recently published supplement to that book, Wonder, Love, and Praise, The United Methodist Hymnal, Japan's Hymnal for the United Church of Christ, and Great Britains' Worship Songs Ancient and Modern. A collection of his hymns, Sing My Soul: David Ashley White Hymnal, was published in 1996 by Selah Publishing Co.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Dr. David Ashley White Papers consist of forty boxes of materials dating from 1965 to 2001 with the bulk of the collection dating from 1980-1998. The first donation to this collection occurred in 1991, which was processed in 1993. Dr. White has made numerous additions since then and future material is expected. This collection consists of published and manuscript scores, programs, correspondence, audio-visual materials, and other items relating to his career as both a composer and music instructor. The collection has been divided into six series: Scores and Manuscripts, Programs, Correspondence, Professional Activities, Personal Materials and Audio/Visual Materials.

The Scores and Manuscripts series dates from 1965-2001, with the bulk of the series dating from 1980-1998. This is the largest series in the collection with nineteen boxes containing hundreds, of Dr. White's original pencil/ink manuscripts. The series has been arranged into eight sub-series based on the type of musical composition: Choral Music, Chamber Music, This Bitterly Beautiful Land, Larger Orchestral Works, Solo Voice with piano and/or Other Instruments, Solo Instruments, Hymn Tunes, and Miscellaneous. Published pieces have been included when available.
There are 181 folders in this sub-series, which have been arranged alphabetically by title. This is the strongest area of the collection containing most of the sacred and secular vocal compositions.

scopecontent.p: There are twenty-two folders in this sub-series, which have been arranged alphabetically by title. This sub-series includes the manuscript for Lament, the earliest musical piece by Dr. White in this collection. The requisite instrumentation is given for each piece.

scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains a cantata commissioned by the Concert Chorale of Houston as part of the Texas Sesquicentennial Celebration in 1986. A research grant in the spring of 1985 facilitated the composing of this work. This sub-series includes background materials and notes, individual movements, instrumental parts, and both incomplete and complete scores.

scopecontent.p: There are six folders in this sub-series, which have been arranged alphabetically by title. Aside from This Bitterly Beautiful Land, these are the most elaborate of Dr. White's compositions.

scopecontent.p: There are nine folders in this sub-series, which have been arranged alphabetically by title. The voice type and instrumentation are given with each piece.

scopecontent.p: There are nine folders in this sub-series. Solo Instruments included are flute, organ, and piano. The pieces have been arranged first by instrument and then alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Reflections On a Tune organ solo, June 1986

scopecontent.p: There are 115 folders in this sub-series, which have been arranged alphabetically by title. David Ashley White is considered by many to be one of the most prolific hymn composers of modern times. Many of these hymns have been selected for publication by Selah Publishers. The researcher may also wish to look at the Correspondence Series for additional information on Selah Publishers. Published hymns have been included with their appropriate title. Proofs for Dr. White's Hymnary are included at the end of this sub-series.

scopecontent.p: There are three folders in this sub-series containing unidentified scores, musical notebooks, and manuscript fragments. These scores, while unidentified, most certainly relate to the compositions found in the preceding folders.

There are five boxes in this series consisting of various programs of performances of David Ashley White's works. Dr. White's works have been performed extensively throughout North America and Europe. The programs are arranged chronologically. Venues with large numbers of performances have been foldered separately, placed in chronological order, and are found at the end of the series.

St. Paul's United Methodist Church, Houston, 1994-2000

scopecontent.p: This series consists of five boxes and has been divided into five sub-series: Publishers, Selah Publishing, Individuals, Miscellaneous Letters, and Kent Kennan. The box of Selah Publishing materials (box 25, folder 22) contains relevant catalogs of Dr. White's music.
There are nineteen folders in this sub-series arranged alphabetically by publisher, then chronologically within each folder.
There are nine folders in this sub-series containing correspondence, catalogs, various hymns and hymn proofs.

did.unittitle: Various Hymns of David Ashley White, Miscellaneous
First set of Proofs for David Ashley White Hymnary, 1996
Second set of Proofs for David Ashley White Hymnary, 1996

scopecontent.p: There are twelve folders in this sub-series arranged alphabetically by last name. Correspondents include David Tomatz, former Director of the School of Music; James Pickering, former President of UH; and Christoper Theofanidas, one of Dr. White's many students.

did.unittitle: Christopher Theofanidas, 1988-1998, (See Audio Cassettes box 37, items 6-11)

scopecontent.p: There are nine folders in this sub-series consisting of cards and letters from various churches, universities, and individuals. Items are arranged chronologically except for non-dated material found in box 28, folder 3.

There are two boxes containing sixteen folders in this sub-series. The folders are arranged chronologically and include manuscripts and published scores as well as books by Kent Kennan used by David Ashley White.

scopecontent.p: There are over three boxes in this series which has been divided into four sub-series: University of Houston Moores School of Music, Legal, Conferences and Papers, and Clippings and Articles.

did.unittitle: University of Houston Moores School of Music, 1981-2000

scopecontent.p: There are eighteen folders in this sub-series covering Dr. White's work at the University of Houston and The Moores School of Music. Materials include correspondence, awards, promotion and tenure materials, articles, student programs, and class schedules.

did.unittitle: Congratulatory Notes on Directorship of Moores School of Music, 1999

UH - News about David Ashley White, 1981-2000
Moores School of Music - Upscale Weekly, 1993-1998

scopecontent.p: There are six folders in this sub-series dealing primarily with the legal aspects of music publishing. Included are materials related to Dr. White's membership in the American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers (ASCAP), contracts, and copyright permissions. This sub-series is arranged chronologically.

There are fifteen folders in this sub-series containing a variety of papers Dr. White has presented during his professional career. It is arranged alphabetically by organization name, title of the paper, or geographic location, as appropriate.

scopecontent.p: There are eight folders in this sub-series containing reviews of performances and compositions taken from local and national newspapers and professional journals.

scopecontent.p: There are thirteen folders in this series containing various personal items including photographs, materials from Dr. White's education, poetry, and musical scores composed by other individuals.

scopecontent.p: There are seventy-eight items in this series including audio cassettes, record albums, and a video. Contents of these items include various performances of Dr. White's compositions and lectures by or interviews with Dr. White. Some items are arranged alphabetically and some by topic.
